[Given : R = 0.082 L atm K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1]

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements. One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : The first ionization enthalpy for oxygen is lower than that of nitrogen.

Reason R : The four electrons in 2p orbitals of oxygen experience more electron-electron repulsion.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both A and R are are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
options.B: Both A and R are are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
options.C: A is correct but R is not correct.
options.D: A is not correct but R is correct.

questions.question:
Given below are two statements. One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. 
Assertion A : The first ionization enthalpy for oxygen is lower than that of nitrogen. 
Reason R : The four electrons in 2p orbitals of oxygen experience more electron-electron repulsion. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements.

$$\bullet$$ Statement I : In CuSO4 . 5H2O, Cu-O bonds are present.

$$\bullet$$ Statement II : In CuSO4 . 5H2O, ligands coordinating with Cu(II) ion are O-and S-based ligands.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
options.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
options.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.question_text:
A box contains 0.90 g of liquid water in equilibrium with water vapour at 27$$^\circ$$C. The equilibrium vapour pressure of water at 27$$^\circ$$C is 32.0 Torr. When the volume of the box is increased, some of the liquid water evaporates to maintain the equilibrium pressure. If all the liquid water evaporates, then the volume of the box must be __________ litre. [nearest integer]

(Given : R = 0.082 L atm K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1)

(Ignore the volume of the liquid water and assume water vapours behave as an ideal gas.)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:

If all the liquid water evaporates, then the volume of the box must be __________ litre. [nearest integer]

For real numbers a, b (a > b > 0), let

Area $$\left\{ {(x,y):{x^2} + {y^2} \le {a^2}\,and\,{{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}} + {{{y^2}} \over {{b^2}}} \ge 1} \right\} = 30\pi $$ 

and

Area $$\left\{ {(x,y):{x^2} + {y^2} \le {b^2}\,and\,{{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}} + {{{y^2}} \over {{b^2}}} \le 1} \right\} = 18\pi $$

questions.question_text: A vessel contains 16g of hydrogen and 128g of oxygen at standard temperature and pressure. The volume of the vessel in cm3 is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A vessel contains 16g of hydrogen and 128g of oxygen at standard temperature and pressure. The volume of the vessel in cm^{3} is :

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : The electric force changes the speed of the charged particle and hence changes its kinetic energy; whereas the magnetic force does not change the kinetic energy of the charged particle.

Statement II : The electric force accelerates the positively charged particle perpendicular to the direction of electric field. The magnetic force accelerates the moving charged particle along the direction of magnetic field.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
options.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
options.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.question:

Statement II : The electric force accelerates the positively charged particle perpendicular to the direction of electric field. The magnetic force accelerates the moving charged particle along the direction of magnetic field. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text: The Vernier constant of Vernier callipers is 0.1 mm and it has zero error of ($$-$$0.05) cm. While measuring diameter of a sphere, the main scale reading is 1.7 cm and coinciding vernier division is 5. The corrected diameter will be _________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The Vernier constant of Vernier callipers is 0.1 mm and it has zero error of ($$-$$0.05) cm. While measuring diameter of a sphere, the main scale reading is 1.7 cm and coinciding vernier division is 5. The corrected diameter will be _________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2} cm.

questions.question_text:
A small spherical ball of radius 0.1 mm and density 104 kg m$$-$$3 falls freely under gravity through a distance h before entering a tank of water. If, after entering the water the velocity of ball does not change and it continue to fall with same constant velocity inside water, then the value of h will be ___________ m.

(Given g = 10 ms$$-$$2, viscosity of water = 1.0 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 N-sm$$-$$2).
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A small spherical ball of radius 0.1 mm and density 10^{4} kg m^{$$-$$3} falls freely under gravity through a distance h before entering a tank of water. If, after entering the water the velocity of ball does not change and it continue to fall with same constant velocity inside water, then the value of h will be ___________ m. 
(Given g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2}, viscosity of water = 1.0 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$5} N-sm^{$$-$$2}).

questions.question_text: In an experiment to determine the velocity of sound in air at room temperature using a resonance tube, the first resonance is observed when the air column has a length of 20.0 cm for a tuning fork of frequency 400 Hz is used. The velocity of the sound at room temperature is 336 ms$$-$$1. The third resonance is observed when the air column has a length of _____________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics

The velocity of the sound at room temperature is 336 ms^{$$-$$1}. The third resonance is observed when the air column has a length of _____________ cm.

questions.question_text: Two resistors are connected in series across a battery as shown in figure. If a voltmeter of resistance 2000 $$\Omega$$ is used to measure the potential difference across 500 $$\Omega$$ resistor, the reading of the voltmeter will be ___________ V.

questions.question_text:
A potential barrier of 0.4 V exists across a p-n junction. An electron enters the junction from the n-side with a speed of 6.0 $$\times$$ 105 ms$$-$$1. The speed with which electron enters the p side will be $${x \over 3} \times {10^5}$$ ms$$-$$1 the value of x is _____________.

(Given mass of electron = 9 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$31 kg, charge on electron = 1.6 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$19 C.)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A potential barrier of 0.4 V exists across a p-n junction. An electron enters the junction from the n-side with a speed of 6.0 $$\times$$ 10^{5} ms^{$$-$$1}. The speed with which electron enters the p side will be $${x \over 3} \times {10^5}$$ ms^{$$-$$1} the value of x is _____________. 
(Given mass of electron = 9 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$31} kg, charge on electron = 1.6 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$19} C.)

questions.question_text:
The displacement current of 4.425 $$\mu$$A is developed in the space between the plates of parallel plate capacitor when voltage is changing at a rate of 106 Vs$$-$$1. The area of each plate of the capacitor is 40 cm2. The distance between each plate of the capacitor is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 m. The value of x is __________.

(Permittivity of free space, E0 = 8.85 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$12 C2 N$$-$$1 m$$-$$2).
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
The displacement current of 4.425 $$\mu$$A is developed in the space between the plates of parallel plate capacitor when voltage is changing at a rate of 10^{6} Vs^{$$-$$1}. The area of each plate of the capacitor is 40 cm^{2}. The distance between each plate of the capacitor is x $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$3} m. The value of x is __________. 
(Permittivity of free space, E_{0} = 8.85 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$12} C^{2} N^{$$-$$1} m^{$$-$$2}).

questions.question_text: The moment of inertia of a uniform thin rod about a perpendicular axis passing through one end is I1. The same rod is bent into a ring and its moment of inertia about a diameter is I2. If $${{{I_1}} \over {{I_2}}}$$ is $${{x{\pi ^2}} \over 3}$$, then the value of x will be ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The moment of inertia of a uniform thin rod about a perpendicular axis passing through one end is I_{1}. The same rod is bent into a ring and its moment of inertia about a diameter is I_{2}. If $${{{I_1}} \over {{I_2}}}$$ is $${{x{\pi ^2}} \over 3}$$, then the value of x will be ____________.

questions.question_text: In a double slit experiment with monochromatic light, fringes are obtained on a screen placed at some distance from the plane of slits. If the screen is moved by 5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 m towards the slits, the change in fringe width is 3 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 cm. If the distance between the slits is 1 mm, then the wavelength of the light will be ____________ nm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In a double slit experiment with monochromatic light, fringes are obtained on a screen placed at some distance from the plane of slits. If the screen is moved by 5 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2} m towards the slits, the change in fringe width is 3 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$3} cm. If the distance between the slits is 1 mm, then the wavelength of the light will be ____________ nm.

questions.question_text: An inductor of 0.5 mH, a capacitor of 200 $$\mu$$F and a resistor of 2 $$\Omega$$ are connected in series with a 220 V ac source. If the current is in phase with the emf, the frequency of ac source will be ____________ $$\times$$ 102 Hz.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An inductor of 0.5 mH, a capacitor of 200 $$\mu$$F and a resistor of 2 $$\Omega$$ are connected in series with a 220 V ac source. If the current is in phase with the emf, the frequency of ac source will be ____________ $$\times$$ 10^{2} Hz.
